page.title: 20NATURE RESERVE GREENFORD
page.content: The Litten Nature Reserve contains oak, ash, grassland and woodland. Without some work and attention to keep the diversity the area would grow back to its original oakland. There are hedgehogs, wood mice and shrews; wrens, bullfinches, fly catchers and many common garden and woodland birds. There are no rabbits because the area is too small. Play groups, middle and high schools come to see the reserve and sometimes to help tidy up. There is a weekly nature club for children. One lady complained about what she thought were rats but they were squirrels knocking over the dustbins for scraps of food. She bought some poison and the squirrels ate it and died. Some men were going to build flats and the local people had to fight to keep Litten, and of course they won. Sophia Aziz
